headline: CNN Special Reports
subHeadline: CNN Special Report: Steve Bannon, Divided We Fall. Aired 11p- 12a ET

utterances.speaker: MILES TAYLOR, FORMER TRUMP ADMINISTRATION DHS CHIEF OF STAFF
utterances.sentences: His vision is almost messianic.

utterances.speaker: STEVE BANNON, FORMER WHITE HOUSE CHIEF STRATEGIST
utterances.sentences: You're witnessing a political realignment.DREW GRIFFIN, CNN SENIOR INVESTIGATIVE CORRESPONDENT (voice-over): CNN investigates Steve Bannon and a political movement based on lies.

utterances.speaker: DAVID CHALIAN, CNN POLITICAL DIRECTOR
utterances.sentences: He knows who won the 2020 election.

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: This illegitimate Biden regime.

utterances.speaker: CHALIAN
utterances.sentences: You sow some doubt, and you create a movement.

utterances.speaker: CROWD
utterances.sentences: Stop the steal! Stop the steal!GRIFFIN (voice-over):  From American politics.

utterances.speaker: WENDY AHRENKIEL, GEORGIA HOUSE CANDIDATE
utterances.sentences: Steve Bannon was the one that I heard say, you've got to get involved grassroots.

utterances.speaker: BILL GATES, CHAIRMAN, MARICOPA COUNTY, AZ BOARD OF SUPERVISORS
utterances.sentences: It's about dividing this country.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  To the world stage.

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: Let them call you racist. Wear it as a badge of honor.

utterances.speaker: JOSHUA GREEN, AUTHOR
utterances.sentences: He studied factual propagandists.WOLFGANG ISCHINGER, FORMER GERMAN AMBASSADOR TO THE U.S.:  Steve Bannon, the single most dangerous American who came our way. GRIFFIN (voice-over):  His role leading up to January 6th.

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: It's not going to happen like you think it's going to happen.

utterances.speaker: SARA MURRAY, CNN POLITICAL CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: He is comparing it to the revolutionary war. BANNONGRIFFIN (voice-over):  And his master plan for upcoming elections.

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: It is about who counts the votes, and guess what, we're going to count them.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  With rare interviews. BRAD PARSCALE, FORMER TRUMP 2020 CAMPAIGN MANAGER:  Bannon was calling the plays. He was the oracle. GRIFFIN (on camera):  Mr. Bannon, why do you continue to push the lie that the 2020 election was stolen?

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: It's not a lie.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Is this the end of democracy? BANNON (voice-over):  We will govern for 100 years. GRIFFIN (voice-over):  "Steve Bannon: Divided We Fall."

utterances.speaker: STACY ALTIERY, PRECINT CHAIR, DEKALB COUNTY, GEORGIA
utterances.sentences: Would you like a copy of the Constitution?

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: Thanks for coming out.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Stacey Altieri, a newcomer to politics, is a local precinct chair in Dekalb County, Georgia.

utterances.speaker: ALTIERY
utterances.sentences: This is time to get involved. We have a bunch of people that have had it. Not anymore. When the censorship started just in front of your eyes, the economy, things going down in schools, I said, you know what, this is craziness.

utterances.speaker: AHRENKIEL
utterances.sentences: With Stacy and I being friends, we would talk amongst ourselves, and we would say, what is going on? What's happening to our country, to our children, to our economy?GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Wendy Ahrenkiel and Jodi Diodati, both Republicans.

utterances.speaker: JODI DIODATI, GEORGIA HOUSE CANDIDATE
utterances.sentences: (INAUDIBLE).GRIFFIN (voice-over):  And first-time candidates. Both running for seats in Georgia's House of Representatives. Both inspired to run by one man.

utterances.speaker: DIODATI
utterances.sentences: I was just kind of going up the channels, and I landed on this guy. I was, like, God, he looks so familiar. Who is that? I recognize him. And it was Steve Bannon.

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: We have a unique once, not in a generation, lifetime opportunity to destroy this left-wing globalist cabal. AHRENKIELGRIFFIN (on camera):  And how do you two go from that to becoming candidates?

utterances.speaker: DIODATI
utterances.sentences: We ask ourselves that daily.(LAUGHTER)

utterances.speaker: AHRENKIEL
utterances.sentences: -- what are we doing.GRIFFIN (on camera):  Did you know much about him before that? His involvement with Trump's campaign, the White House, all of that?

utterances.speaker: AHRENKIEL
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: DIODATI
utterances.sentences: No.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Steve Bannon has never been elected to any office, never confirmed by Congress for any position, but potentially has more influence on the political direction of the nation today than almost anyone besides Donald Trump.

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: We believe in the ballot box. We believe in fair and free and transparent elections. And we're winning everywhere. We're going to win 80 to 100-seat pickup in the House of Representatives. We're going to win the Senate. We're going to win the governorships. We're going to win the state legislatures. This is going to be a massive blowout. You're witnessing right now a political realignment, and we will govern for 100 years after we win 100 seats.

utterances.speaker: GREEN
utterances.sentences: Bannon sees himself as the narrator in a great, grand conspiracy of his own devising.

utterances.speaker: CHALIAN
utterances.sentences: Steve Bannon is the intellectual and cultural navigator for the modern-day Trump era Republican Party, setting the agenda even more than Donald Trump.

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: The whole reason we started the 6GRIFFIN (voice-over):  His pathway to destroy the Democratic Party, control who runs the elections by putting the ultra MAGA in charge. BANNON:  It is about who counts the votes. And guess what? We're going to count them because we've got the election officials that are showing up.

utterances.speaker: GREEN
utterances.sentences: One thing that stopped the overthrow of the 2020 election was that Republican precinct workers said no. They said, we're not going to overturn what was a valid election. I think Bannon saw that and said, if Donald trump runs in 2024 and the same thing happens, I want to make sure that we have people in those positions that will overturn the election for Trump, even if he loses it.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Bannon insists he wants every vote to be counted legally. But his entire movement is based on the lie that Donald Trump, not Joe Biden, actually won the 2020 election.

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: We will never concede. We will never say this election was not stolen.

utterances.speaker: ALTIERY
utterances.sentences: I was never inspired to be involved in politics until this last election.GRIFFIN (on camera):  And what about that election inspired you?

utterances.speaker: ALTIERY
utterances.sentences: To see all the anomalies during the election. There's no way that Biden could have ever won an election. He didn't campaign. The most unpopular person. If you believe that that was a safe and fair election, I mean, I just can't help you.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  The truth is it was a safe, fair, and legitimate election.

utterances.speaker: CROWD
utterances.sentences: Stop the steal! Stop the steal!GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Yet, tens of millions of Trump fans don't believe it.

utterances.speaker: GATES
utterances.sentences: Steve Bannon has had a great influence on where my party, the Republican Party, has gone. He has a type of politics that is about hatred. It's about dividing this country and generating distrust of our institutions.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Beyond just spreading disinformation, Bannon motivates.

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: Everybody should be a precinct committeeman. Now is the time to get in power.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: I thought, okay, a precinct committeeman.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  He has inspired an entire army of political neophytes to take over the Republican Party.

utterances.speaker: MARK KNOWLES, PRECINCT TESTIMONIAL
utterances.sentences: I have to do something. I just can't sit around.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Far-right candidates who believe in election conspiracy theories flock to Bannon's "War Room," from lower level officials to members of Congress, even Senate hopefuls it.

utterances.speaker: ERIC GREITENS, FORMER MISSOURI GOVERNOR
utterances.sentences: Join the MAGA crew. Get a RINO hunting permit.

utterances.speaker: CHALIAN
utterances.sentences: The extreme characters, the folks where you're just like, how are these people in public life? How are they seeking office? Bannon has carved out a space in the Republican Party for these folks to have a seat at the table.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Of the more than 100 MAGA politicians who have appeared on Bannon's "War Room," more than two dozen have won their primary races so far.

utterances.speaker: GREEN
utterances.sentences: Bannon's approach to everything is, how can I weaponize this? How can I take this energy and redirect it towards my own goals?GRIFFIN (on camera):  Seems almost diabolically disingenuous.

utterances.speaker: GREEN
utterances.sentences: I think that's a term that he would happily embrace.BENJAMIN HARNWELL, INTERNATIONAL EDITOR, BANNON'S WAR ROOM:  He loves the image of being seen as this Darth Vader figure pulling the strings from behind the scenes. We've moved into a post-objective reality society, right? GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Ben Harnwell is the international editor for Bannon's "War Room."

utterances.speaker: HARNWELL
utterances.sentences: Some of these are the facts and the other side will say, you know, perhaps these are the facts.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Harnwell, based in Rome, frequently appears on the show and admits Bannon's version of the so-called facts is what's covered on "War Room."

utterances.speaker: HARNWELL
utterances.sentences: He has an ability to identify what the number one headline topic of conversation should be and bringing people on board, basically framing it as the national debate.

utterances.speaker: PARSCALE
utterances.sentences: He's the disciple that's delivering that MAGA movement.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Brad Parscale, Trump's former digital director and campaign manager, gave CNN a rare interview to talk about his mentor, Steve Bannon.

utterances.speaker: PARSCALE
utterances.sentences: His message, his ability to carry out message and understand the people is why he's good at telling the story and why people are following him online.GRIFFIN (on camera):  In terms of messaging, it seems to me that Bannon uses fear a lot.

utterances.speaker: PARSCALE
utterances.sentences: Well, I mean, fear is one of the great marketing tactics of all time. Fear sells.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Using fear has served Bannon well since his days making dark political documentaries in the early 2000s.

utterances.speaker: GREEN
utterances.sentences: He showed me once shot for shot how he was copying in his own films what she had done in her films, so it gives an idea of the depth of his belief in propaganda.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  But it wasn't until he took over the alt-right media site Breitbart in 2012 that Bannon found a way to spread his message of fear and motivate millions.

utterances.speaker: KURT BARDELLA, FORMER BREITBART SPOKESPERSON
utterances.sentences: Truth and fact are not words that are used there. It's narrative.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Kurt Bardella, a spokesperson for Breitbart at the time, watched as Bannon's populist website began to steer the Republican Party in an alt-right direction.

utterances.speaker: BARDELLA
utterances.sentences: When you look at the pages of Breitbart, the overt racist comments from the Breitbart audience was littered across the pages.GRIFFIN (voice-over): Breitbart's audience would grow to millions of readers per month.

utterances.speaker: GREEN
utterances.sentences: One of his great insights is these sorts of people can be radicalized politically if you incentivize them to come over, to become part of your army, to read what it is you're writing, and then to point them towards a goal.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Bannon's mantra is flood the zone. He would flood the news cycle through Breitbart and find persuadable voters through a company he helped launch called Cambridge Analytica. Christopher Wylie, now a whistleblower, was its director of research.

utterances.speaker: CHRISTOPHER WYLIE, CAMBRIDGE ANALYTICA WHISTLEBLOWER
utterances.sentences: The ultimate goal of Cambridge Analytica was simply to identify and recruit people, and those served as a foundation for this alt-right movement.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Through Cambridge Analytica aa early as 2014, Bannon was pretesting U.S. political campaign platforms like drain the swamp, deep state, and build the wall. Brittany Kaiser was the director of business development. She has turned whistleblower.

utterances.speaker: BRITTANY KAISER, CAMBRIDGE ANALYTICA WHISTLEBLOWER
utterances.sentences: As the company became more and more successful, it became more obvious that it was specifically to just promote his political ideals.

utterances.speaker: DONALD TRUMP, FORMER PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES
utterances.sentences: Our leaders are stupid. Our politicians are stupid. And the Mexican government, they send the bad ones over because they don't want to pay for them.

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: You finally have a guy that's speaking in a non-political vernacular. He's a very imperfect instrument, but he's an armor- piercing shell.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Bannon would use Trump like ammunition, feeding him into the ready-to-fire army of online followers that Bannon had been molding for years.

utterances.speaker: GREEN
utterances.sentences: Millions of people out there who spend all day online, who can kind of be whipped into a frenzy, what Bannon was doing, as he told me, was to try to harness that energy specifically to build an online army on behalf of Trump.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Trump plowed through a republican field.

utterances.speaker: HILLARY CLINTON, FORMER UNITED STATES SECRETARY OF STATE
utterances.sentences: Thank you!GRIFFIN (voice-over):  And now faced what polls showed was an unbeatable foe, Hillary Clinton. Less than three months before the election, this unconventional armor-piercing candidate fired his campaign manager and put Steve Bannon in charge.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: The most dangerous political operative in America. The new CEO of Donald Trump's campaign.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: He will make the Nixon administration look like Mary Poppins. He's a dangerous man.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Bannon would make Trump's message focus on one woman.

utterances.speaker: CROWD
utterances.sentences: Lock her up! Lock her up! Lock her up!

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: For what she's done, they should lock her up.

utterances.speaker: PARSCALE
utterances.sentences: I think the narrative against her was one of the strongest suites. Keep America great.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Brad Parscale was digital director of Trump's 2016 campaign and for a time run his 2020 campaign. He had a front row seat to it all. (On camera):  What did Bannon bring to you that you needed?

utterances.speaker: PARSCALE
utterances.sentences: Narrative. Bannon was calling the plays. Steve is an expedite. He was great at verbal warfare. When he counter-punch, will you take the punches? When he leans in, will you lean away? All those decisions lead to political victories. All that roots from that inception about narrative.

utterances.speaker: CHALIAN
utterances.sentences: I've never seen a politician in my lifetime like Trump engender the kind of dedication from his supporters. And part of that is Bannon's understanding almost like a maestro what notes to hit with them.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Bannon would write the tune, Brad Parscale and an army of digital warriors would use Facebook on a scale never seen before.

utterances.speaker: PARSCALE
utterances.sentences: 2016, Hillary Clinton made 66,000 ads online. I made 5.8 million. The only person that could approve a commercial other than Donald Trump was Bannon. Bannon looked at every TV commercial I make and, like, that is not angry enough or this isn't tough enough, that's just too soft, turn to this, say this, Brad.UNKNOWN (voice-over):  You know what's deplorable? Hillary Clinton viciously demonizing hard working people like you. GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Bannon's targeted strategy appeared to be working. Then came a bombshell.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: Donald Trump uncensored caught on tape speaking in vulgar language about kissing and groping women.TRUMP (voice-over):  When you're a star, they let you do it. You can do anything. BILLY BUSH, RADIO HOST (voice-over):  Whatever you want. TRUMP (voice-over):  Grab them by the pussy. You can do anything.

utterances.speaker: PARSCALE
utterances.sentences: I remember the Billy Bush tape. All of a sudden, the RNC people disappeared from multiple buildings. You know, they thought it was over.GRIFFIN (on camera):  And Bannon came up with the counterpunch.

utterances.speaker: PARSCALE
utterances.sentences: Yeah. I never remember one inch where Bannon gave up. People came to us and say, what's going to happen? How should we do this? He was the oracle.

utterances.speaker: GREEN
utterances.sentences: The most outrageous, audacious thing he can think to do was to pull in these Clinton accusers. [23GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Bannon's defense against the tape, to go on offense. Hours before the second presidential debate, Steve Bannon brought together four women claiming abuse at the hands of the Clintons, which the Clintons had long denied.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: Why don't you go ask Bill Clinton that?

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: My girl, Paula Jones, the first one, Bill Clinton raped me, right, and just boom! And they hit it. It was perfect.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Just beyond the forced smiles there they were.

utterances.speaker: GREEN
utterances.sentences: All of a sudden, the story on cable news isn't Donald trump and the "Access Hollywood" tape.

utterances.speaker: PARSCALE
utterances.sentences: If you look at the photos that the press took of everyone standing on the side, you'll see Steve Bannon there in the corner with a smirk on his face. At that moment. you'll see the genius of Steve Bannon.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Bannon staged a media coup. The Trump campaign never looked back.

utterances.speaker: WOLF BLITZER, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: Right now, a historic moment. CNN projects Donald Trump wins the presidency.

utterances.speaker: PARSCALE
utterances.sentences: I went to the president and said, sir, you need to get dressed. You've won. I remember Bannon standing right there next to me, and Bannon was, like, yeah, you won, sir. Everyone got pretty emotional, obviously. I still am today. One of those moments I'll never forget. I can see Bannon was proud. Everyone was really proud. The president walked up to me and said, good job, Brad, you really did a good job, but just don't stand next to me on stage.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Because you're too tall.

utterances.speaker: PARSCALE
utterances.sentences: I'm too tall.(LAUGHTER)

utterances.speaker: PARSCALE
utterances.sentences: The last thing Donald Trump said before being president of the United States is, Brad, don't stand next to me.GRIFFIN (on camera):  What was Bannon thinking at the time?

utterances.speaker: GREEN
utterances.sentences: That he created this political revolution. And now, he's going to have the kind of Bannon that he only dreamed about.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Bannon was now chief strategist and senior counsellor to the president of the United States.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: This American carnage stops right here and stops right now.(APPLAUSE) GRIFFIN (voice-over):  And Bannon wasted no time.

utterances.speaker: PARSCALE
utterances.sentences: The White House is on his big board. He had like 100 things he wanted to get done in the first 100 days.

utterances.speaker: MURRAY
utterances.sentences: The first year of the Trump White House was total chaos. None of these people who are coming in, including Steve Bannon, had any idea how to govern. The chaos didn't really bother him, and also, he was fueling it.

utterances.speaker: TAYLOR
utterances.sentences: He wanted no aspect of presidential power and influence to be off limits.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  He even got a seat on the National Security Council through Trump's executive order. It elevated Bannon to a position that had long been limited to top generals and senior cabinet officials.

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: We didn't win an election to bring the country together.

utterances.speaker: GREEN
utterances.sentences: I think most people in the White House hated Bannon's guts because he's a difficult guy to work with, he's explosive, he's a backstabber, he's leaking in the press both about how great he is and about how bad his enemies are, and ultimately, I think that's why he only lasted seven months in the White House.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Who was running the country became the butt of jokes.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: Send in Steve Bannon.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  "Saturday Night Live" portrayed Bannon as the grim reaper, Trump as his puppet.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: I'll go silt at my desk.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  When "Time" magazine named Bannon the great manipulator, he had violated an unwritten rule of getting more press than Donald trump.

utterances.speaker: PARSCALE
utterances.sentences: That "Time" magazine cover, the "Saturday Night Live" skits with Trump in the small desk, none of that was good for Bannon's future in the White House.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Neither was his constant battle with Trump's family. Bannon would be fired.

utterances.speaker: TYLOR
utterances.sentences: When Bannon left the White House, there was an immense feeling of relief. With Bannon gone, maybe the rhetoric would become more civil. That ended up not being the case at all. And in very short order, Bannon was back on the outside helping lead the mob and continuing to advance the MAGA movement.(COMMERCIAL BREAK) [23:25:00] (COMMERCIAL BREAK) GRIFFIN (voice-over):  In the final weeks of the 2020 campaign, Steve Bannon was already talking about a stolen election.

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: You see the ballot harvesting that's going on? What are your lying eyes tell you?GRIFFIN (voice-over):  But now in a leaked recording of a meeting three days before election day, Bannon is heard outlining the very plan Donald Trump would use if he lost. BANNON (voice-over):  What Trump's going to do, is just declare victory. Right? He's going to declare victory. But that doesn't mean he's the winner. He's just going to say he's the winner. GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Bannon admitted that the stolen election lie would be just that, a lie. Trump would lose and Trump would falsely claim he won.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Frankly, we did win this election.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Steve Bannon would go on to back the lie with his every breath.

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: They know they stole this, and they also know that we're going to show they stole it.

utterances.speaker: MURRAY
utterances.sentences: He is comparing it to like the revolutionary war.

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: Grow up. We're in a war right now.

utterances.speaker: GATES
utterances.sentences: There's such an intimidation factor by Steve Bannon and those around him.UNKNOWN (voice-over):  This is our breaking news at this hour. GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Arizona had gone for Biden. Bannon attacked the vote and aimed his stolen election ire at local officials like the Maricopa County Board of Supervisors.

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: The guys in Maricopa County, you can hide, but you're going to be found.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Bill Gates, a Republican and chair of the board, suddenly found himself being threatened for certifying a fair election.

utterances.speaker: GATES
utterances.sentences: My colleagues and I have been subjected to many threats. There was a guillotine that was set up outside of the Arizona Capitol here for the board of supervisors.

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: We're here for reality. Trump won a massive landslide on the 3rd of November.

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: We're going to run the Green Bay Sweep.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Dubbed by Bannon the Green Bay Sweep, the plan called for right-wing members of Congress who object the certification of the election when lawmakers convened on January 6th. Trump attorney, John Eastman, outlined the legal theories. JOHN EASTMAN, ATTORNEY FOR THE 2020 TRUMP CAMPAIGN:  We need to bolster the authority of our leaders in Congress to not accept fraudulently certified slates of electors. GRIFFIN (voice-over):  According to the plot, Vice President Mike Pence could then refuse to certify the votes and send the election back to the states where fake electors would flip the vote for Trump.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: Donald J. Trump at the state of Florida, number of votes, 11.

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: If Pence decides that it can't be certified, kicks it back to state legislatures, then that election is over.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  "War Room" would talk about Mike Pence in 37 shows in the lead up to January 6th. Eastman was a frequent guest. The plot is now part of an investigation by the Department of Justice and the January 6 Committee.

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: Live from our nation's capital, you're in the field headquarters of one of the small divisions of the bloodless coup.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  To make the plan work, Bannon sought to pressure lawmakers and told his listeners to the same.

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: Step by step by step, day by day, understanding we're all going to converge on that point on the 6th.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  It was, as he told them, their moment to save America.

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: I met so many people in my life, man, if I was in a revolution, I would be at Washington in Trenton, right, or I would be in the civil war. Well, you know, this is where -- this is for your time in history.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  On January 5th, Bannon and Trump would speak by phone at least twice, and Bannon joined a meeting of Trump's inner circle at the Willard Hotel, according to a congressional subpoena, in an effort to persuade members of Congress to block the certification of the election.

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: It's not going to happen like you think it's going to happen. It's going to be quite extraordinarily different. And all I can say is strap in. The "War Room" a posse. You've made this happen. Tomorrow is game day. So, strap in. Let's get ready.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  The next day, on January 6th, as a mob gathered outside the Capitol, Steve Bannon was in his "War Room" studio telling the vice president to execute the plan and overturn a fair election.

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: The play has been called. Mike Pence, run the play. Take the football. Take the handoff from the quarterback.

utterances.speaker: MIKE PENCE, FORMER VICE PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES
utterances.sentences: The votes for president of the United States are as follows.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Pence refused.

utterances.speaker: CROWD
utterances.sentences: Hang Mike Pence! Hang Mike Pence!GRIFFIN (voice-over):  It could have cost the vice president his life. He fled the congressional chambers down a back staircase as an angry mob searched the building for him.

utterances.speaker: CROWD
utterances.sentences: Stop the steal! Stop the steal!GRIFFIN (voice-over):  History will record it as a failed coup. The vice president upheld the Constitution. But Steve Bannon's listeners have a different view.

utterances.speaker: ALTIERY
utterances.sentences: On the day that Pence could have helped out, which was January 6th, if I'm not mistaken, he proved himself to be an establishment person. He didn't stick up for -- and it changed a lot, including myself.GRIFFIN (on camera):  He stood up for the Constitution.

utterances.speaker: ALTIERY
utterances.sentences: He, in my personal, what I took from this is that you know what? Pence isn't the kind that I had hoped he was. He's part of the establishment.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  These three women and millions like them are what Bannon hopes is the future of the Republican Party and the United States. Bannon calls it the precinct strategy.

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: Ergo, we're going to take over everything from school boards all the way up to the House and the Senate.

utterances.speaker: MURRAY
utterances.sentences: He is really talking about from the ground up remaking a party that is Trump loyal, MAGA loyal kind of party.

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: Okay, I want to start with Dan Schultz, precinct strategy.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  The precinct strategy's author is a Bannon regular, Dan Schultz, a local Arizona attorney.

utterances.speaker: DAN SCHULTZ, ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: If we conservatives don't take over the Republican Party, we're going to lose our republic.

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: President Trump comes out and endorses the precinct strategy.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  His step-by-step tutorial for taking over republican politics is now considered almost gospel, inspiring thousands of believers in the election lie to get involved. GOP leaders in more than 20 counties, in mostly battleground states, told CNN they have seen a spike in participation.

utterances.speaker: ALTIERY
utterances.sentences: I'm a precinct committee person. We need folks. We'll have someone get in touch with you. My friends and I decided we didn't want to sit around and bitch anymore. It was time to take it back, and that is what we are doing.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Without exception, they believe Joe Biden lost in November 2020.

utterances.speaker: DIODATI
utterances.sentences: Did Biden get more than Obama? No way. They say he got the most votes of any president ever. Just remember the energy around Obama and there was --

utterances.speaker: ALTIERY
utterances.sentences: There's still energy around Obama than there is Biden.

utterances.speaker: DIODATI
utterances.sentences: Yeah, I just didn't see that lining up.

utterances.speaker: AHRENKIEL
utterances.sentences: For me, my thing with it is, I just would just to know what happened, and I do think that the evidence is there and it's not being seen.

utterances.speaker: TAYLOR
utterances.sentences: We've watched American society go from trust in and reliance upon institutions. Now, they don't trust it. And people like Trump and Bannon have convinced them that what they see with their eyes and hear with their ears is false, and it has genuinely created two alternate realities existing simultaneously in this country.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Nowhere is that more evident than Michigan.

utterances.speaker: BETH PADULA, MICHIGAN PRECINCT DELEGATE CANDIDATE
utterances.sentences: I happened to stumble upon Steve Bannon and Dan Schultz.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Beth Padula answered Bannon's call, is running to be a precinct delegate and says she wants to support candidates who believe the election was stolen.

utterances.speaker: PADULA
utterances.sentences: Thousands and thousands of ballots that were dropped off in the middle of the night in Detroit.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  In Michigan, precinct delegates have even more power because they, not the general public, determine the winners of some primary elections. That is how two election deniers promoted by Steve Bannon are now the Republican candidates for secretary of state and attorney general.

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: But I've got to go to a superstar in Michigan, Matt DePerno. Matt, you're a hero and a patriot.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Ultra MAGA candidates from Texas to Ohio, Arizona and Pennsylvania line up to campaign on Bannon's podcast.

utterances.speaker: DOUG MASTRIANO, PENNSYLVANIA GUBERNATORIAL NOMINEE
utterances.sentences: Thank you, Steve, and thanks for helping to introduce me to Pennsylvania and America as well. What you do here really does have consequences.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Doug Mastriano, now the Republican candidate for governor in Pennsylvania, has told Bannon should he win, he will control the state's elections.

utterances.speaker: MASTRIANO
utterances.sentences: As governor, I get to decertify any or all machines in the state.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Though it's impossible to predict what will happen in November, the real danger is that the ultra MAGA detached from reality could take control of elections and impact whose votes count, whose do not, essentially eliminating the democratic process. BEN GINSBERG, CO-CHAIR, ELECTION OFFICIALS LEGAL DEFENSE NETWORK:   If in fact this is an attempt to take away the vote of the people for a pre-ordained outcome that Steve Bannon or Donald Trump or their followers like, then that's as anti-democratic and anti-American as it gets. GRIFFIN (voice-over):  But Bannon's actions do not end at the U.S. borders. He's seeking a new world order based on a scary past.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: (SPEAKING IN FOREIGN LANGUAGE).GRIFFIN (voice-over):  This year for the first time, CPAC was held in Europe and chose Hungary, and had its authoritarian leader, Viktor Orban, speak. He has forced white nationalism, clamped down on the press, and taken control of his country's courts.

utterances.speaker: VIKTOR ORBAN, HUNGARIAN PRIME MINISTER
utterances.sentences: We must take back the institutions in Washington and Brussels.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Republicans ate it up. Steve Bannon not only at admires Orban, but advised him for years. Bannon's work is not limited to the United States, and he has given new life to Europe's very dark past.

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: What I have been working on since I went over there in 2018 is that these groups have to work together.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Starting in 2018 after his firing from the White House, Bannon has been trying to get populous leaders across Europe to join forces turning the continent back decades.

utterances.speaker: ISCHINGER
utterances.sentences: Looking back over the last 70 years, the post-World War II period, in my view, Steve Bannon was the single most dangerous American who came our way.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Bannon traveled across Europe, meeting with populist leaders, firing up populist crowds.

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: The tide of history is with us and it will compel us to victory after victory after victory.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Promoting the growth of what he calls a Judeo- Christian West.

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: They are the kind of people that the Judeo-Christian West has developed. They have a voice in Orban, Matteo Salvini, Le Pen, Trump, Bolsonaro and others.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Bannon would call this push the "movement."

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: The thing that we're going do at the "movement" is like in the United States- before I took over the Trump campaign. We're actually going to provide the tools and the building blocks for victory.GRIFFIN (on camera):  What is the "movement?"

utterances.speaker: HARNWELL
utterances.sentences: The "movement" is an idea to create market (ph) movement of separate nationalist political parties around Europe so they can all fight together on the issues of common interests, come position obviously with regards to illegal immigration.

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: I'm going to go first to Ben Harnwell in Rome.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Ben Harnwell is Bannon's international editor based in Rome. (On camera):  It's interesting but also strange to me that you would bring in all these far-right politicians from different countries.

utterances.speaker: HARNWELL
utterances.sentences: They are not far right.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  They are. Around Bannon's extravagant recruiting tables in Europe were far-right leaders from more than a half dozen countries. REP. PAUL GOSAR (R-AZ):   Father, we're gathering around this table with friends and comrades. GRIFFIN (voice-over):  To bless the gathering, Bannon brought along MAGA far-right Arizona Congressman Paul Gosar, the "movement" unofficial ambassador.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: I see stand for option (ph).

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: ISCHINGER
utterances.sentences: We were scared.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Wolfgang Ischinger is Germany's former ambassador to the U.S.

utterances.speaker: ISCHINGER
utterances.sentences: Poisoning the political atmosphere in Europe. We thought he's now going to bring a virus back into Europe, which we had hoped to have gotten rid of after World War II.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  What Bannon wants is to replace every progressive European leader with a far-right autocrat like Hungary's Orban.

utterances.speaker: NATHALIE TOCCI, DIRECTOR, INSTITUTE FOR INTERNATIONAL AFFAIRS
utterances.sentences: If we had 27 Viktor Orban, the current prime minister of Hungary, across the 27-member states of the European Union, there would not be a European Union.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Bannon inflamed tensions in Europe as Muslim refugees from Africa and the Middle East flooded across borders. Bannon called it an invasion. He was labeled a racist and didn't care.

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: Let them call you racism. Let them call xenophobes. Let them call you nativists. Wear it as a badge of honor.GRIFFIN (on camera):  Wear it like a badge.

utterances.speaker: HARNWELL
utterances.sentences: You know why he says that? When you fight the establishments, they will come back at you and call you white supremacist, neo-Nazi, racist, fascist. You know you have won because they have no arguments to come back against your actual policy platform.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  To cement the movement to change Europe's culture, Bannon sought to create a school in this 13th century Italian monastery.

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: And we call it a modern gladiator school.GRIFFIN (on camera):  A modern gladiator school.

utterances.speaker: HARNWELL
utterances.sentences: That's right.GRIFFIN (on camera):  That conjures up fighting and violence to me.

utterances.speaker: HARNWELL
utterances.sentences: I don't think it really does. I think that it comes --GRIFFIN (on camera):  Gladiator school.

utterances.speaker: HARNWELL
utterances.sentences: Yeah. I think what it comes up to is the idea that if you're talking about culture warriors, then we're having a finishing school for culture warriors.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Bannon and Harnwell's group, DHI, got approval to rent and restore this national treasure founded by peaceful monks in the year 1211. Politicians like Lia Quartapelle were stunned.

utterances.speaker: LIA QUARTAPELLE, MEMBER OF ITALIAN PARLIAMENT, DEMOCRATIC PARTY
utterances.sentences: I was shocked. We feared that the school could become the operational center of national populism in Europe. It was quite scary. He wanted to implant a school to teach how to hate, how to deceive, and how to divide our societies.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  The school never taught a single student. Italy's government accused the DHI of lying on its application and kicked them out of the monastery.

utterances.speaker: QUARTAPELLE
utterances.sentences: Americans should know that Bannon here lied and forged.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  But it's Harnwell who is facing fraud charges.

utterances.speaker: HARNWELL
utterances.sentences: It is important that you see the horrific miscarriage of justice that the Italian state inflicted in this action and it's the basis on which we have appealed.GRIFFIN (on camera):  And you believe it was pure political?

utterances.speaker: HARNWELL
utterances.sentences: Well, it was 100% political.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Among the allegations, DHI never paid its rent to the government. In fact, CNN confirmed this letter from a bank that supposedly verified DHI's financing for the project was fraudulent. DHI also told the Ministry of Culture it had five years-experience running a cultural museum as was required. But we went to the location of that so-called museum with Italian investigative reporter Giorgio Mottola. This is the museum that he was managing.

utterances.speaker: GIORGIO MOTTOLA, ITALIAN INVESTIGATIVE REPORTER
utterances.sentences: Yes. The museum of Benjamin Harnwell and Steve Bannon. The little museum of San Nicolas.GRIFFIN (on camera):  You're not kidding. This is a stable.

utterances.speaker: MOTTOLA
utterances.sentences: Yeah.GRIFFIN (on camera):  It's filled with hay.

utterances.speaker: MOTTOLA
utterances.sentences: A stable for donkeys.(LAUGHTER) GRIFFIN (on camera:  And obviously, very well used by the donkeys.

utterances.speaker: MOTTOLA
utterances.sentences: Yeah, completely.(LAUGHTER) GRIFFIN (on camera):  We went to it.

utterances.speaker: HARNWELL
utterances.sentences: Yeah.GRIFFIN (on camera):  It was a stable.

utterances.speaker: HARNWELL
utterances.sentences: Yeah.GRIFFIN (on camera):  For a donkey.

utterances.speaker: HARNWELL
utterances.sentences: Yeah.GRIFFIN (on camera):  Filled with hay.

utterances.speaker: HARNWELL
utterances.sentences: Yeah.GRIFFIN (on camera):  So, you actually ran a museum there?

utterances.speaker: HARNWELL
utterances.sentences: Yeah. And there wasn't a museum there in the stable. The museum was in the old chapel which is under lock and key on the floor above.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Despite our request, Harnwell offered CNN no proof of any museum behind this locked door.

utterances.speaker: MOTTOLA
utterances.sentences: So, we went to find also the priest who managed in the past this church. We asked him if it was a museum, and he told us there never had been a museum there.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Bannon's gladiator school and the movement might be over, but some far-right nationalist parties are still surging and Bannon is still spreading his praise for autocratic rulers.

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: Putin's speech the other night, but if you read it, it's so logical. Putin today gave a serious talk -- had a serious talk with the Russian people. That was a level of seriousness you will not see with the clowns on Capitol Hill.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: Mr. Bannon!GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Steve Bannon has been called liar, racist, evil. UNKNOWN (voice-over):  You're a traitor to this country.

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: Thanks, fans.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  He thinks it's a sign he's winning.

utterances.speaker: TAYLOR
utterances.sentences: It's not that there's a war between the rational Republicans and the radical Republicans. The radical side won. They took over the party. They're in control of the party.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Just look at the number of establishment Republican lawmakers leaving office, election officials quitting, the number of Republicans who believe the election was stolen, and who don't believe that this -- (SCREAMING) GRIFFIN (voice-over):  -- was carried out by Trump supporters.

utterances.speaker: AHRENKIEL
utterances.sentences: I want to know the truth of what happened that day.

utterances.speaker: DIODATI
utterances.sentences: Show me the footage.

utterances.speaker: AHRENKIEL
utterances.sentences: Yeah, show me the footage.GRIFFIN (on camera):  I've seen the windows being broken and the people jumping through the windows.

utterances.speaker: DIODATI
utterances.sentences: And who were the people that were breaking the windows?GRIFFIN (on camera):  Proud Boys.

utterances.speaker: DIODATI
utterances.sentences: Do we know that? Could they have been Antifa?GRIFFIN (on camera):  We know the names of them, actually.

utterances.speaker: DIODATI
utterances.sentences: Could they have been Antifa?GRIFFIN (on camera):  No, they weren't Antifa. We know the names of them. (Voice-over):  When the January 6 Committee subpoenaed Steve Bannon to find out just what he knows about that day, he refused to testify or produce documents, and was convicted on two counts of contempt of Congress.

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: We may have lost the battle here today, but we're not going to lose this war. I stand with Trump and the Constitution. And I will never back off that ever.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Bannon tries to turn every lawsuit to a win (ph). But this time, he may pay a price.

utterances.speaker: MURRAY
utterances.sentences: The judge just ran through the factors at play here.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Bannon sentenced to four months in jail on each count to be served at the same time. But he won't have to go to jail immediately. A judge is saying he can wait until his appeal goes through.

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: On November 8th, they're going to have judgment on the illegitimate Biden regime.

utterances.speaker: TAYLOR
utterances.sentences: There's got to be some accountability here. These people believe that they are above the law.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Outside a hearing in this condemned case, CNN caught up to Bannon. (on camera):  Why do you continue to push the lie that the 2020 election was stolen?

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: It's not a lie.GRIFFIN (on camera):  It's a lie. You have no proof. We've looked at all the facts.

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: You haven't -- I'd tell you --GRIFFIN (on camera):  You don't have the facts.

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: Hey, hold on.GRIFFIN (on camera):  Rudy doesn't have the facts.

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: Hey, do me a favor, get this guy. I want to sit down with you this week for two hours and go through all the evidence. Okay?GRIFFIN (on camera):  Okay. How about Friday? BANNON:  Friday. Done. GRIFFIN (on camera):  All right.

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: Done deal.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  Despite that pledge, the interview never happened. Bannon ultimately ignored all our requests for interviews. Bannon faces other serious criminal charges as well. Long before the contempt case, he was indicted on federal fraud charges for allegedly funneling a million dollars in public donations from a private Build the Wall Foundation. Donald Trump granted him a pardon.

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: This is what happens in the last days of a dying regime.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  But new state charges in the wall scheme could send him to prison for more than a decade.

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: They will never shut me. They'll have to kill me first.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  He has pleaded not guilty to money laundering and conspiracy charges. This time, there will be no pardon.

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: I have not yet begun to fight. We are going to win a sleeping landslide at every level.GRIFFIN (voice-over):  But his calls for revolution are being made between court appearances. The question is, will Bannon's prophecy come true in November?

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: Pray for our enemies, okay? Pray for them because we're going medieval on these people. We're going to savage our enemies.

utterances.speaker: GATES
utterances.sentences: My greatest fear is that we have people who are elected, who will tip the balance in the elections in 2024. If that happens, I think our democracy then will be truly teetering on the edge.

utterances.speaker: GREEN
utterances.sentences: If Republicans win back power, if they win back control of Congress in November, Joe Biden will be impeached. Bannon has told me this.

utterances.speaker: BANNON
utterances.sentences: We're not going to rest until we decertify, decertify every Biden elector.GRIFFIN (on camera):  Is he dangerous to democracy?
